author: pburba
msg: Follow-up to r18479 - The rest of the patch.
In a move of unparalleled idiocy I didn't commit the full patch to handle
xlate differences on the OS400/EBCDIC port.  Specifically, I didn't *use*
the new symbols SVN_APR_LOCALE_CHARSET and SVN_APR_UTF8_CHARSET in utf.c.
Use SVN_APR_LOCALE_CHARSET in place of APR_LOCALE_CHARSET.

author: pburba
msg: OS400/EBCDIC Port: Handle xlate page differences.
This is one of several patches to allow Subversion to run on IBM's
OS400 uses integers (Coded Character Set Identifiers or CCSIDs in
IBM-speak) to represent charsets rather than strings, e.g. 1208 vs.
"UTF-8".  This has two implications for the subversion code:
1) apr_xlate_open() has a different signature, taking ints for topage
2) APR_DEFAULT_CHARSET and APR_LOCALE_CHARSET are of type int not
The addition of new "wrapper" symbols for APR_DEFAULT_CHARSET and
APR_LOCALE_CHARSET address the bulk of these problems, leaving only
some minor error message creation tweaks.
Use SVN_APR_LOCALE_CHARSET in place of APR_LOCALE_CHARSET.
SVN_APR_LOCALE_CHARSET in place of APR_DEFAULT_CHARSET and
APR_LOCALE_CHARSET respectively.  Disable assert that doesn't
apply to V5R4 and handle error condition this may now permit.
Cast arguments to apr_xlate_open() to agree with OS400 signature.
topage and frompage members are always ints on OS400 when

author: jerenkrantz
msg: Defer setup of requests until we need to deliver them.
This corresponds to r914 of serf.  With this change, we see our memory usage
drop from around 110MB to around 50MB on a checkout.
(setup_serf_req): this and don't try to create the request here.
(log_context_t): Add session, path, buckets, acceptor, and handler.
(setup_log): New function that will be called back when we are about to
(report_context_t): Add in path, acceptor, and handler.
(handle_fetch): Simplify the case where we have to reset ourselves.
(fetch_file): See svn_ra_serf__get_log; Allocate fetch_ctx_t from dir->pool.
(pop_state): If we're going to change an existing file, fetch its delta base.
(Add a blankspace where there should have been one.)
(setup_serf_req): this and don't try to create the request here; Remove
(loc_context_t): Add session, path, buckets, acceptor, and handler.
